newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - July 31.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - July 31.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Thursday:

* On Wednesday, the Dow Jones industrial average jumped 80.36 points to 8,254.89 as optimism over the economy and the balanced budget pact drove bonds higher and pushed long-term interest rates to their lowest levels in nearly 18 months.
* Indonesia's Coordinating Minister for Production and Distribution Hartarto said on Wednesday the government supported a restructuring plan proposed by PT Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa .
Indocement said on July 15 its proposal to sell its 50.1 percent stake in Indofood, mostly to QAF, was aimed at focusing on its core cement business.

* On Wednesday, the Jakarta Composite Index closed up 5.62 points, or 0.79 percent at 721.98 points on the back of a spurt of late buying, particularly in cement stocks, following a positive outlook for the sector, brokers said.
* On Thursday, the rupiah was traded at 2,585.00/88.00 at 0140 GMT against an opening of 2,575.00/85.00.
* Cement stocks Semen Gresik, Semen Cibinong and Indocement on positive outlook of the sector and specific issues affecting each cement giant.
* Bank Niaga as Standard & Poor's placed the bank on negative credit watch after the announcement of its acquisition by the Tirtamas Group.
* Steady Safe on reports the transport firm expects to buy a 19.9 percent stake in toll road operator Citra Marga.
* Mining firm Inco as it first half net profit fell sharply due to lower production and lower international nickel prices.
* Finance firm Multidana as it posted a first half net profit of 101.07 billion rupiah, up from 18.87 billion rupiah in the same 1996 period.
* Lippo Life as it posted a net profit of 65.8 billion rupiah in the first half of 1997, against 14 billion rupiah in the same period of 1996.
